title: Authenticating
text: method can useful running R interactively outside RStudio, ideal way solving problem code run non-interactively later date - e.g. shiny app, another package, part script shared. use cases, better take advantage “FPL_LOGIN” “FPL_PASSWORD” environment variables. set, used authenticate options. can set .Renviron file avoid re-enter credentials every time use package. Make sure add .Renviron .gitignore using Git project.

title: Authenticating
text: authentication function works sending POST request FPL API storing resulting authentication cookie option session. cookie used whenever restricted action taken. can see cookie running getOption("FANTASY_COOKIE"). unset remove , need reauthenticate. authentication cookie temporary, authenticate every R session run. However, can use Environment Variables method avoid enter credentials every time.

title: Managing your team
text: Behind functionality described , <team> class provided package. class ensures validation output formatting, well restricting use functions provided package, avoid errors. <team> object , tibble 15 players, three key attributes: player ID captain, player ID vice-captain, ‘submission order’ team (FPL requires players position order, starting XI bench). addition , several restrictions team can constructed object validated every attempted action - see FPL Website information restrictions . IMPORTANT: Note changes made fantasy team confirm changes, done undone. actions matter can make substitution change captain many times want, make transfer count towards transfer quota (gameweeks 1). update_team() function default ask confirmation confirm transfer worth making sure understand - {fantasy} blame confirm transfer end regretting!

title: Authors and Citation
text: Chris Brownlie. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brownlie C (2022). fantasy: Fantasy Premier League API Wrapper. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://chrisbrownlie.github.io/fantasy/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {fantasy: Fantasy Premier League API Wrapper},   author = {Chris Brownlie},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://chrisbrownlie.github.io/fantasy/}, }

title: Fantasy Premier League API Wrapper
text: {fantasy} wrapper Fantasy Premier League API. provides clean, intuitive set functions extract key data available API, well enabling actions transfers team changes enacted programmatically. authenticating, package provides new class object (<team>) takes care various restrictions team, can simply make transfers substitutions package notify valid (e.g. 3 players 1 club, enough certain position team/starting XI, transfer exceeds budget etc.). <team> class also enables pretty printing team (see usage ). maintains tidyverse-like style, functions returning tibbles readable column names. package also provides helper functions obtaining data useful sources, predicted team lineups fantasyfootballscout.co.uk relevant tweets twitter.

title: Fantasy Premier League API Wrapper
text: can install development version {fantasy} GitHub :

title: Fantasy Premier League API Wrapper
text: already exists least two R packages wrap Fantasy Premier League API: fplR fplscrapR reasons building {fantasy} two packages : regularly maintained, may work current (2022/23) version FPL API, implement authentication, used perform actions retrieve private user information, built using {httr2} benefit functionality. {fantasy} aims address three .

title: Fantasy Premier League API Wrapper
text: examples use key functions package.
code: library(fantasy) #> ℹ Loading fantasy #> ℹ Enabling function caching... # Get all fixtures from the current season get_fixture_list() #> # A tibble: 380 × 11 #>       id gameweek finished kickoff_time        minutes home_team home_…¹ home_…² #>    <int>    <int> <lgl>    <dttm>                <int> <chr>       <int>   <int> #>  1     1        1 TRUE     2022-08-05 00:00:00      90 CRY             0       3 #>  2     4        1 TRUE     2022-08-06 00:00:00      90 FUL             2       5 #>  3     2        1 TRUE     2022-08-06 00:00:00      90 BOU             2       2 #>  4     5        1 TRUE     2022-08-06 00:00:00      90 LEE             2       2 #>  5     7        1 TRUE     2022-08-06 00:00:00      90 NEW             2       2 #>  6     8        1 TRUE     2022-08-06 00:00:00      90 TOT             4       2 #>  7     3        1 TRUE     2022-08-06 00:00:00      90 EVE             0       4 #>  8     6        1 TRUE     2022-08-07 00:00:00      90 LEI             2       2 #>  9     9        1 TRUE     2022-08-07 00:00:00      90 MUN             1       2 #> 10    10        1 TRUE     2022-08-07 00:00:00      90 WHU             0       5 #> # … with 370 more rows, 3 more variables: away_team <chr>, away_score <int>, #> #   away_difficulty <int>, and abbreviated variable names ¹​home_score, #> #   ²​home_difficulty #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows, and `colnames()` to see all variable names  # Get stats from a particular fixture, by ID get_fixture_stats(fixture_id = 2) #> # A tibble: 42 × 5 #>    fixture_id stat         team  player       value #>         <int> <chr>        <chr> <chr>        <int> #>  1          2 goals_scored home  Moore            1 #>  2          2 goals_scored home  Lerma            1 #>  3          2 assists      home  Kelly            1 #>  4          2 yellow_cards home  Smith            1 #>  5          2 yellow_cards home  Pearson          1 #>  6          2 yellow_cards home  Billing          1 #>  7          2 yellow_cards away  Ings             1 #>  8          2 yellow_cards away  Douglas Luiz     1 #>  9          2 yellow_cards away  Ramsey           1 #> 10          2 saves        home  Travers          2 #> # … with 32 more rows #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows  # Get all team info get_teams() #> # A tibble: 20 × 19 #>     code  draw team_id  loss name  played points posit…¹ short…² stren…³ unava…⁴ #>    <int> <int>   <int> <int> <chr>  <int>  <int>   <int> <chr>     <int> <lgl>   #>  1     3     0       1     0 Arse…      0      0       0 ARS           4 FALSE   #>  2     7     0       2     0 Asto…      0      0       0 AVL           3 FALSE   #>  3    91     0       3     0 Bour…      0      0       0 BOU           2 FALSE   #>  4    94     0       4     0 Bren…      0      0       0 BRE           3 FALSE   #>  5    36     0       5     0 Brig…      0      0       0 BHA           3 FALSE   #>  6     8     0       6     0 Chel…      0      0       0 CHE           4 FALSE   #>  7    31     0       7     0 Crys…      0      0       0 CRY           3 FALSE   #>  8    11     0       8     0 Ever…      0      0       0 EVE           3 FALSE   #>  9    54     0       9     0 Fulh…      0      0       0 FUL           2 FALSE   #> 10    13     0      10     0 Leic…      0      0       0 LEI           3 FALSE   #> 11     2     0      11     0 Leeds      0      0       0 LEE           2 FALSE   #> 12    14     0      12     0 Live…      0      0       0 LIV           5 FALSE   #> 13    43     0      13     0 Man …      0      0       0 MCI           5 FALSE   #> 14     1     0      14     0 Man …      0      0       0 MUN           4 FALSE   #> 15     4     0      15     0 Newc…      0      0       0 NEW           3 FALSE   #> 16    17     0      16     0 Nott…      0      0       0 NFO           2 FALSE   #> 17    20     0      17     0 Sout…      0      0       0 SOU           3 FALSE   #> 18     6     0      18     0 Spurs      0      0       0 TOT           4 FALSE   #> 19    21     0      19     0 West…      0      0       0 WHU           3 FALSE   #> 20    39     0      20     0 Wolv…      0      0       0 WOL           3 FALSE   #> # … with 8 more variables: win <int>, strength_overall_home <int>, #> #   strength_overall_away <int>, strength_attack_home <int>, #> #   strength_attack_away <int>, strength_defence_home <int>, #> #   strength_defence_away <int>, pulse_id <int>, and abbreviated variable names #> #   ¹​position, ²​short_name, ³​strength, ⁴​unavailable #> # ℹ Use `colnames()` to see all variable names  # Get all players info get_players() #> # A tibble: 585 × 56 #>       id name         known…¹ posit…²  team team_…³  cost points point…⁴ point…⁵ #>    <dbl> <chr>        <chr>   <chr>   <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #>  1     1 Cédric Alve… Cédric  DEF         1       3   4.4      0       0     0   #>  2     3 Granit Xhaka Xhaka   MID         1       3   5       12      14     7   #>  3     4 Mohamed Eln… Elneny  MID         1       3   4.4      0       0     0   #>  4     5 Rob Holding  Holding DEF         1       3   4.4      0       0     0   #>  5     6 Thomas Part… Partey  MID         1       3   5        2       5     2.5 #>  6     7 Martin Ødeg… Ødegaa… MID         1       3   6.5      2       5     2.5 #>  7     8 Kieran Tier… Tierney DEF         1       3   4.9      1       2     1   #>  8     9 Nicolas Pépé Pépé    MID         1       3   5.4      0       0     0   #>  9    10 Benjamin Wh… White   DEF         1       3   4.5      1       6     3   #> 10    11 Eddie Nketi… Nketiah FWD         1       3   6.9      1       2     1   #> # … with 575 more rows, 46 more variables: cost_change_recent <dbl>, #> #   cost_change_from_start <dbl>, form <dbl>, value_form <dbl>, #> #   value_season <dbl>, selected_by_pct <dbl>, transfers_in_recent <dbl>, #> #   transfers_in_total <dbl>, transfers_out_recent <dbl>, #> #   transfers_out_total <dbl>, expected_points_this_week <dbl>, #> #   expected_points_next_week <dbl>, minutes <dbl>, goals_scored <dbl>, #> #   assists <dbl>, clean_sheets <dbl>, goals_conceded <dbl>, own_goals <dbl>, … #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows, and `colnames()` to see all variable names  # Get a particular player's season statistics get_player_summary(player_id = 283) #> # A tibble: 38 × 33 #>    element_id fixture_id round kickoff_time        at_home team_h team_…¹ team_a #>         <dbl>      <int> <int> <dttm>              <lgl>   <chr>    <int> <chr>  #>  1        283          4     1 2022-08-06 00:00:00 FALSE   FUL          2 LIV    #>  2        283         16     2 2022-08-15 00:00:00 TRUE    LIV          1 CRY    #>  3        283         27     3 2022-08-22 00:00:00 FALSE   MUN         NA LIV    #>  4        283         36     4 2022-08-27 00:00:00 TRUE    LIV         NA BOU    #>  5        283         48     5 2022-08-31 00:00:00 TRUE    LIV         NA NEW    #>  6        283         55     6 2022-09-03 00:00:00 FALSE   EVE         NA LIV    #>  7        283         67     7 2022-09-10 00:00:00 TRUE    LIV         NA WOL    #>  8        283         74     8 2022-09-18 00:00:00 FALSE   CHE         NA LIV    #>  9        283         87     9 2022-10-01 00:00:00 TRUE    LIV         NA BHA    #> 10        283         91    10 2022-10-09 00:00:00 FALSE   ARS         NA LIV    #> # … with 28 more rows, 25 more variables: team_a_score <int>, #> #   total_points <int>, difficulty <int>, minutes <int>, goals_scored <int>, #> #   assists <int>, clean_sheets <int>, goals_conceded <int>, own_goals <int>, #> #   penalties_saved <int>, penalties_missed <int>, yellow_cards <int>, #> #   red_cards <int>, saves <int>, bonus <int>, bps <int>, influence <chr>, #> #   creativity <chr>, threat <chr>, ict_index <chr>, value <int>, #> #   transfers_balance <int>, selected <int>, transfers_in <int>, … #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows, and `colnames()` to see all variable names  # Authenticate to allow restricted actions - see vignette for more information authenticate() #> ℹ Sending login request for user chris.brownlie@hotmail.co.uk... #> ✔ Login successful, overwriting existing cookie... #> ✔ Authentication successful!  # See your team get_my_team() #> ℹ Team: #> GKP: 15-Ramsdale (VC) #> DEF: 430-Dier; 299-Walker; 10-White; 280-Van Dijk #> MID: 283-Salah; 428-Son; 305-Grealish; 370-S.Longstaff #> FWD: 166-Edouard; 255-Vardy (C) #> (Bench): 398-Henderson; 199-Tarkowski; 465-Bowen; 391-Surridge  # Swap two players in your team # - {fantasy} will automatically handle any restrictions or reordering of your team get_my_team() %>%   team_substitute(p1 = 465, p2 = 166) #> ℹ Team: #> GKP: 15-Ramsdale (VC) #> DEF: 430-Dier; 299-Walker; 10-White; 280-Van Dijk #> MID: 283-Salah; 428-Son; 305-Grealish; 370-S.Longstaff; 465-Bowen #> FWD: 255-Vardy (C) #> (Bench): 398-Henderson; 199-Tarkowski; 166-Edouard; 391-Surridge  # Change the captain or vice captain get_my_team() %>%   assign_role(pid = 255, role = "c") %>%   assign_role(pid = 15, role = "vc") #> ℹ Team: #> GKP: 15-Ramsdale (VC) #> DEF: 430-Dier; 299-Walker; 10-White; 280-Van Dijk #> MID: 283-Salah; 428-Son; 305-Grealish; 370-S.Longstaff #> FWD: 166-Edouard; 255-Vardy (C) #> (Bench): 398-Henderson; 199-Tarkowski; 465-Bowen; 391-Surridge  # After making any changes, update your team on the FPL site get_my_team() %>%   team_substitute(p1 = 465, p2 = 166)%>%   assign_role(pid = 255, role = "c") %>%   assign_role(pid = 15, role = "vc") %>%   update_team() #> → Creating payload... #> → Sending POST request... #> ✔ Team update successful! #> ℹ Team changes: #> ─ No transfers. #> ↑Subs In: Bowen (MID) #> ↓Subs Out: Edouard (FWD) #> ─ No captaincy changes.  ### Non-FPL API functions # Get predicted lineups from fantasyfootballscout.co.uk get_predicted_lineups() #> # A tibble: 220 × 3 #>    team    selection player            #>    <chr>       <dbl> <chr>             #>  1 Arsenal         1 Ramsdale          #>  2 Arsenal         2 White             #>  3 Arsenal         3 Saliba            #>  4 Arsenal         4 Gabriel Magalhães #>  5 Arsenal         5 Zinchenko         #>  6 Arsenal         6 Odegaard          #>  7 Arsenal         7 Partey            #>  8 Arsenal         8 Xhaka             #>  9 Arsenal         9 Saka              #> 10 Arsenal        10 Jesus             #> # … with 210 more rows #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows
